title: Collaborative Learning Design Based on a Pharmacy Learning Community

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pharmaceutical theory and data analysis skills grounded in mathematics
context.additional_context: A process where pharmacy major students form learning communities and perform collaborative learning based on mathematical thinking in a blended online-offline environment utilizing digital devices

learning_goals: Learners achieve collaborative communication skills for solving pharmacy-related mathematical problems with over 80% participation in a learning community.
Learners improve their ability to analyze and interpret pharmaceutical learning materials by 30% compared to pre-assessment through a peer mentoring system.
Learners submit individual and team-based learning outcomes with over 90% completion rate via weekly formative assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
